call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - April 17th

decisions.decision: Establishing the Palm DAO in Japan using their regulatory tooling for legally enforceable on-chain contracts
decisions.speaker: Dan Friedman
decisions.context: Japan has developed regulatory tooling for DAOs that makes on-chain contracts legally enforceable
decisions.quote: interestingly enough, in Japan, they've developed regulatory tooling like this. So we're actually thinking about establishing the DAO in Japan.

decisions.decision: 2025 Colorado Springs event will be October 10th, 11th and 12th
decisions.speaker: qx()
decisions.context: Announcing the official dates for the Colorado Springs event
decisions.quote: October 10th 11th and 12th. So the main thing is the 11th people get there the 10th We'll do something and then maybe breakfast on the 12th when everybody goes home

decisions.decision: Open sourcing the Colorado Springs event planning through GitHub
decisions.speaker: qx()
decisions.context: Making the event planning process collaborative like the rest of Ergo
decisions.quote: we're open sourcing it just like the rest of Ergo so if you are in the Ergo chats head to look for I guess I'll pin it in a second but look for the pin and there's a GitHub

commitments.commitment: 50k worth of Palm tokens will be distributed to Ergo community
commitments.timeline: As soon as Ergo support is added
commitments.quote: Uncle Dan, when six 50k worth of Palmarinos. We still haven't forgotten about that. That is gonna come. What soon, like I said, as soon as the Ergo support is added

commitments.commitment: Will have conversation with Sam and Luca about publishing staking requirements for Ergo
commitments.quote: I'll have that conversation with Sam and with Luca, well, Luca at the office tomorrow.

commitments.commitment: Expanding Palm dev team to add more support
commitments.quote: we're actually expanding our our dev team to to give us more support

open_questions.question: Whether to force governance to one chain using Rosen or build natively on all chains
open_questions.context: Discussion about multi-chain governance UX vs technical complexity

open_questions.question: What minimum requirements need to be on each chain for legally compliant multi-chain DAO
open_questions.context: Understanding regulatory compliance for multi-chain governance

key_facts.fact: Palm token launched multi-chain using Rosen Bridge at launch
key_facts.speaker: Dan Friedman

key_facts.fact: 250 million palms staked, worth about $300,000 in first couple days
key_facts.speaker: Dan Friedman

key_facts.fact: $150,000 worth of daily volume, $350,000 liquidity on Cardano side, $150,000 on Binance side
key_facts.speaker: Dan Friedman

key_facts.fact: Kushti has rough protocol working for sub-blocks, tested with two peers
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: Node 6.0 RC3 has full sync with mainnet and others are starting to test it
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: Flux has 10,000 wallet holders on Ethereum, Rosen-ERG has about 500 on Cardano
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: Kraken listing finder's fee is around $50,000 with no guarantee
key_facts.speaker: qx()

key_facts.fact: Palm FDV is at about 80 million, making market cap around 10 million
key_facts.speaker: Dan Friedman

key_facts.fact: Mark distributed 98 ERGs from storage rent alone plus bonus tokens in mining pool
key_facts.speaker: qx()
